description:
Oh my goodness, thank you my dear coworker for taking me here! The first drink I tried was Winnie The Pooh, which was my favorite drink until I decided that Melinda needed a smoothie instead. 

Their passion fruit smoothie is amazing! D: (It's so good, I'm sad) This is the best passion fruit smoothie I've ever had. I think the only difference is that they're adding milk? But whatever it is, gahhh deliciousness overload! 

Great service! Tiny spot, so it can get really crowded. Will definitely stop by again whenever I'm in the area.
author: Melinda T.

description:
A pretty standard bubble tea spot. I'm pretty sure this is owned by enjoy veggie next door since the only thing separately them is a thin wall that is detachable. Also when we paid with card, it was charged to enjoy veggie. 

I was drawn to this place from their cute reusable cups but we ended up just getting the plain cups since we probably wouldn't keep the reusable cups. My boyfriend and I got the regular fruit teas. Drinks were okay, standard, not bad and not great. 

They also have a stamp card!
author: Flora L.

description:
Tiny hole in the wall spot with various combination flavors. Looks like they're popular for their concoctions of different teas with different jelly. I ordered the M&M (mango + matcha) with clear boba. The drink itself was good but the boba was different. It wasnt in a full ball form and it was stuck together which makes me believe it wasn't fresh. 

Not the best place I've tried but definitely glad I did. If I happen to come again, I'd order the winnie the pooh since that seems to be a popular choice.
author: Jenna T.

description:
As I walked across San Francisco's Chinatown neighborhood on 6/12/2018, I stumbled and landed at this small spot located at Kearny Street near Portsmouth Square park and it's attached to Enjoy Vegetarian Chinese restaurant building. It's called, "E Tea." E Tea serves the customers of all ages to taste their finest selections of Taiwanese bubble tea drinks and juices every year! The atmosphere is very active and on-going as I welcomed there. The concept is much similar to your local bubble tea cafes across the U.S. although for E Tea, it's pretty small and compact just like visiting to your local small ticket booth outside the movie theater. The menus here are simply basic giving clearer details before you order.

The baristas here are doing a good job for making the customers like me a remarkable service. No cons.

Now onto the drinks! After I glanced over the drinks menu, I ordered the Rose Green Milk Tea with black bobas with 30% sweetness with regular filled ice cubes. As I drank it, that milk tea tasted impressive! I can feel the mixtures of both rose pedals and green tea leaves combined in an aroma elegant! The 30% sweetness did worked like magic after mixing it completely, so I can satisfy my taste buds in no time! Not a bad drink after a stroll!

Parking at E Tea in San Francisco's Chinatown can be challenging to park. You can park at the nearby surface metered street parking or the parking garage if it's available. Otherwise, you can ride a bike, walk, carpool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

In the end, E Tea is the finest and well established bubble tea shop that I've ever discovered for the first time in San Francisco! Perfect for your everyday drinkie needs! A well received! My rating: 4 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
Just okay. First time trying this spot and I'm a little underwhelmed. Maybe I didn't order the right drink? 

I got the caramel ice milk tea at 75% sweetness with regular ice. This drink was sweet. Even at 75%, it tasted like 110%. And, the drink barely had any ice in it. That could've been why it didn't taste as refreshing. 

Maybe, I'll give it a try again but only if I see it. Not a place I seek nor dislike. It's average.
author: Ngoc P.

description: I love this place its a small stand i feel they should expand their buissness to other cities more here in San Jose Ca soo good yummmm!
author: Corina H.

description:
I grew up watching and following E.T., the "Extra Terrestrial" character. 

I also grew up watching Winnie the Pooh. "I know, it is NOT a "manly" thing to share!" 

This tiny beverage spot, which also shares next to a Chinese vegetarian restaurant: a restaurant I am yellow to try, making its mark by making some cool and unique blended Asian beverages. The cute cow logo is also an enticing logo to sucker kids of all ages, including this 46 year old-fart, to come here. 

I tried coming here many times, but this shop was constantly too crowded. After many attempts to come here, I finally had the opportunity to try the cool beverage naming after the Walt Disney character. For $3.99, the drink is a mixture combination of a strawberry green tea (Pooh's red shirt), a thick mango milk (color of the bear's furry skin) and lychee jelly. I don't drink much of these beverages, because the mixed beverages tend to be on the extreme sweet side. This drink was no exception. Though it may not be as sweet as Pooh's jar of honey. But it was definitely pretty damn close. 

The menu is reasonably priced and really limited with this thirst-quencher being one of the shop's top-seller. Yeah, majority of the customers are much younger and loved this beverage and others from here. 

Normally I would never check in to a business twice in one day, especially from a drink spot. I bought the same beverage for my friend. I got the same beverage, but with the shop's customized plastic bottle for an additional $.50. I heard the shop is not environmentally-friendly and will not reuse the bottle for your next trip. Though I may bicker on them not reusing the plastic bottle, but the bottle is still pretty cool with the cute cow logo. 

I was just wanted to see the hype about this place. I may come here again if only I am thirsty on a "Hot" Summer Day. Hopefully the other drinks would not be overly sweet.
author: Matt G.

description: I love this place! This was the third boba place I tried within the span of 2 days. I love how you can adjust the sweetness and how there were a lot of alternatives for the actual boba. I visited this place twice in one day because I just had to get it again before leaving San Francisco. I will definitely visit again!
author: Janiel E.

description:
Saw this little hole in the wall while driving around China Town. What caught my attention was the cute cow. I wasn't expecting much, but I was wrong. They have a pretty big menu, and to hopefully make things easier, they listed their top 10. I was torn between Black Sesame, Coconut Taro Sago and Winnie The Pooh. I ended up picking Winnie The Pooh (strawberry green tea with mango milk and lychee jelly). The sweetness from the strawberry and mango and earthiness from the green tea mixed so well together! Not one flavor dominated the other. I was expecting a sorta heavy cream, thick tasting drink since it said mango milk but it was more on the lighter side. 

This boba place is no Quickly's nor T4, so don't expect seating or snacks. It's a very small grab-and-go spot. You can choose from soy or almond milk for an additional 50 cents. They do have reusable cups for 50 cents more from the regular plastic cups, BUT I do not think they are cups you can bring back to get a few cents off your next drink. They can serve your drinks in a split cup; also for an additional 50 cents. They serve creama drinks, floats, hot drinks, slushies/ smoothies and cheese  cream drinks. You can also adjust the sweetness and ice level.

I didn't like how the cashier didn't ask what size drink, if we wanted to add any toppings (boba, jellies, etc. etc.), or if we wanted the reusable cup instead.

In my opinion, this small boba spot is worth a try for all you boba lovers and/or just anyone taking a trip around Chinatown in the city and crave something sweet to drink. I will definitely be coming back here, because of the different drink mixture options they have!

P.S. They close at exactly the time listed, so if you happen to be waiting outside, they will gladly let you know they won't be serving you anymore.
author: Rachel C.

description:
I mean... it's okay here... But do I love it enough to really recommend it? Uhhh probably not.

E-tea is located on the edge of Chinatown. I had walked by this particular boba shop a lot absent mindedly in the past, mostly because the location is tiny, and I was finally lured in when they saw that they had cute glass bottles. 

But the glass bottles are pretty deceiving. Normally at a lot of other boba shops it feels like you get slightly more for upgrading to a glass, and HERE they actually charge you more for the glass WHILE giving you less of the actual drink. For a plastic component for $4, you get it in a 24 oz, while in a glass component they'll charge you around $5-6 for 20 oz. 

I'd choose the plastic, because why pay more for less drink, right? I mean the glass bottle is cute, but still.

When I went in, there was virtually no one in line, aside from the person working, who looked bored on their phone. I also tried looking to see if they had a stamp card option there, but couldn't find anywhere in the front, but apparently if you ask they'll provide one for frequent customers.

Winnie the Pooh - ($4) - Half Strawberry Green Tea on the top, with Mango Milk, Mango Chunks, and Lychee Jelly on the bottom. Maybe I expected a lot more since apparently this was one of their top 10 items but I didn't enjoy my drink.

The Strawberry Green Tea top half was fine, but I didn't really love it all that much.

 The mango milk bottom was creamy, but was verging on tasting like it was starting to go past its prime, and the mango chunks on the bottom were also sour and threw me off. Lychee Jelly was fine, but I mean I've never had a bad lychee jelly soooo....

Mixing the drinks together, I completely did not like the drink at all. Separately I think they would have done much better but mixed together, they just seemed to separate from each other and it just tasted a little odd to me.

While E Tea was okay, I certainly was not mind blown over it either, which is why I'd rate E-tea a mid 2.5, going to a 3 but not really there. Out of the tons of boba options in Chinatown, let alone SF, I wasn't impressed enough to want to return nor will I recommend it, as I have other options I like better.
author: Allison O.

description:
Small but cute and compact. The cow logo was what caught my attention at first, but they have a surprisingly large selection of drinks. I hesitated between the Winnie the Pooh and just a regular, so I went with the House boba to be safe. Their cups are pretty big, and it's only $3.99! I'd say pricing was very fair, and the tea was very good! My one complaint is that the server wasn't the friendliest and she sounded sick so I'm not sure about the hygiene of this place..... boba was also very bland and not sweet enough.

Would come back though, probably will try Winnie the Pooh next time!
author: Christine L.

description:
Went to this place for the first time and tried the Winnie the Pooh because the name was just too cute. It also sounds and is delicious: mango milk with lychee jelly on bottom, topped with strawberry green tea. I added boba. It was really good!  Nice and refreshing. I got 75% sugar and it was still pretty sweet (and I have a sweet tooth).

They asked me what kind of cup I want- the normal plastic cup or the reusable one (which costs extra).  When I saw that the normal cup held more ounces than the reusable, the choice was a no-brainer!  The cow on the cup is super cute.  The size of the drinks is the typical "large" size at other boba places, but doesn't cost more than other places- love that the price is reasonable!
author: Josephine L.

description:
Wow! I love this place! I tried the House Milk Tea and it was really good. 

My only complaint is that the boba was a bit chewier than it should be and not sweet. 

The key to good boba is the timing of it and adding sugar or honey while you cook it.

I'll still come back here though because there's a ton of different flavors that I'd like to try. Also, the cow logo??? ADORBS!
author: Cindy N.

description: Now, I know that this place is a franchise..and yet this place is a "hole in the wall". I am a huge fan of bubble tea (Boba tea) and I know I am not the only one. The selection of drinks they have here is pretty good and to even have a choice of the amount of ice and the amount of sweetness (sugar) you want is pretty nice. I must say I recommend it. Lunch time and commute time it does get busy...but what doesn't get busy during those times?
author: Olive R.

description: Went there today since it looked good but there tea is super watery and has no taste ! I would not recommend this place
author: Khushali S.

description: We got Rose Green Milk Tea with boba & Black Milk Tea with boba. They taste more like milk TEA than MILK tea. Pretty disappointed and would rather go to other boba shops next time.
author: Allison C.

description:
Although this is a tiny little spot with no seating (grab-n-go location), the menu selection is huge! 

As a plus, their cow logo is adorable and the cups are cute too. 

I ordered the mango sago -- great texture all around and delicious, creamy mango flavor. Reminded me of mango lassi! 

Easy and convenient spot if you need a quick bubble tea fix.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
First of all, I ought to admit that there is a little bias here (it's skewed to our taste). See, my family tends to put some stock in the Chinese zodiac. And my mom, being born the year of the cow, REALLY LIKES COWS. 

So as we're heading home after a dinner at the Stinky Rose and we place this place by, which my mom recognizes because one of her friends has the glass bottle. And she just ADORES the little cow design on a milk bottle. 

Things to note: Be aware the glass bottles hold 20 ounces in comparison to the 24 oz. of a regular cup (even if the glass bottle cost a few more cents). They also sell a plastic bottle that is good for cold drinks, but not for hot drinks or anything that requires you to put it in a freezer. Additionally, this isn't a sit down place. It's an indoor stand more than anything else, so just heads up: there won't be anyplace to sit here. It was clean, well lit, cheerful, colorful, and busy. Kudos on how the signs and advertisements are attractive and pasted on almost all the walls, the tables, windows, and then the extra board out front.

Because we've had just eaten at Stinky Rose, a place that is famous for it's garlic and garlic-based dishes, I chose to go with a mango slush with boba instead of a milk tea or the King Taro. And honestly? I loved it! There was a lot of boba on the bottom, a layering of some kind of mango gel, and the actual mango slush tasted of mango fruit (not just flavoring). It was thick, and I think that contributed to it lasting pretty long instead of immediately melting into liquid. So there's a plus for getting the glass bottle.

When we were there, it was pretty busy. So it does get a good number of people and small groups after dinner time. After all, it's in a prime spot to take advantage of all the after-dinner and lunch crowds from the nearby restaurants. As a result, we did have to wait a bit. Not long, but for those who are not as comfortable walking out in San Francisco at night and get nervous...(I have some friends who are, as well). But the place itself is well-lit and maintained. Overall, fun experience and I liked what I got. My dad really like the passionfruit tea and my mom is happy with her cute, reusable glass bottles. Would come again to try out some of the other stuff. 

Speaking of reusable, it would be cool if they had an option where you can bring that bottle back in and get it filled with a drink of your choice for a lower price (because discounting the part of actually buying the bottles as part of the purchase). But that's just the nerd in me making a suggestion. That would be cool, though.
author: Christine L.

description:
I don't understand the low rating at all! 
I had the princess rose drink, not as sweet or rosy as it was in my head but very refreshing! S/O had the iced carmel milk.... it made the boba taste amazing, it was very sweet but addictive! 
Please note the menu on the exterior does not match the ordering system so use names of drinks not numbers.
author: Hailey T.

description:
I come here pretty regularly for well over a year. The one thing that makes them stand out over other similar places is their ingredients; they don't taste fake or artificial. Granted, of course I'm sure they use some flavoring but most, if not all, of their fruit flavored drinks contain real fruit.

Winnie the Pooh is a nice contrast of creamy and refreshing. Their fruit teas has a nice balance of fruit to tea, having a nice fruity flavor followed by the slightly bitter tea flavor. I think their non-milk tea options definitely stand out exceptionally whereas their milk teas are pretty standard which is satisfactory but doesn't make them different from most other boba places.

Their prices are more than reasonable, might I even dare to say underpriced for their quality. The staff is friendly and fast. The only "problem" to this place, if you can even call it that, is that it is small so when there is a line or crowd waiting for their drinks, there really isn't anywhere to stand to wait; or sometimes when abnormal weather in San Francisco is occuring, you can't avoid the sun or rain.

I highly recommend this place and I've been to my share of boba places.
author: Richard C.

description:
I love all the flavors truly amazing Mango sago 
I wish they have more branches around the bay 
They also have great customer service 
Please visit ETea in San Francisco - I just love it
author: MariaAnne V.

description:
Don't expect to be absolutely blown away and moo-ved by the milk tea here. Don't get me wrong, it's good but it's not great either.

I came here with some friends and decided to order the oolong milk tea at half sweet. The drink came out with the creamer on top and there were noticeable chunks of the dairy substance that clotted. That didn't really bode too well for me. The tea itself is quite nice and robust with the bitterness of the oolong coming through but something about the sweetener also didn't sit right with both me and my stomach.

My friend's matcha drink turned out satisfactory when I was able to steal a sip. I think the true redeeming factor and hero of the drinks here is the cute cow on the bottle.
author: Jonathan N.

description:
I was really hoping E Tea, with its modern exterior and 'top 10' list would make it into my personal 'top 10' list of boba places in the Bay. But alas, that's what you get for going out on a craving instead of checking where to get a good drink.

I didn't have the customer service problems that other folks experienced, but I did have the same meh experience with the drinks. The Fresh Taro King costs $3.99, which is pretty middle-of-the-road. While I'm fairly certain real taro was blended into it due to the gritty nature of the drink, it seriously lacked flavor. It literally tasted like milk with a hint of root vegetable. I'm not a big advocate for powder in milk tea drinks, but this was one of those cases where it could've used another spoonful.

The glass bottle costs more, of course, but holds a lot less drink than the cup does. Like many other millennials, I may be a sucker for cute packaging, but I'll take the plastic cup if it means I get more bang for my buck. Cups here are tall and skinny (none of that squat, fat cup nonsense LA's teahouses are adopting).

You can frequent a tastier option elsewhere. Seems like this place focuses too much on conceptualizing kitschy ideas, and not enough on following through on flavor.
author: Gwen W.

description:
Not gonna lie...I was drawn in by the cow bottles lol.   Only down side is that I wish there was a hole for the straw!

Anyway, onto the drink review! I ordered the black milk tea with boba (half sweet, regular ice.) The milk tea kinda tasted like chocolate milk to me - not a bad thing! The boba was slightly sweet. I would give this place a solid 3.5 leaning towards a 4 because the service was nice and the cow is cute lol.
author: Andrea F.

description:
Customer service was meh, the people making the drinks and ringing were all over the place; when you order they don't ask you about the size or if you wanted the bottle.
(Ask for a stamp card if you plan on coming back, they won't tell you about it though. I just happened to see the lady next to me have it)

It's a place you order and go, no seats.

The logo is cute and the drinks in my opinion was good. I ordered the #6 coffee milk tea and #4 hokkaido milk tea. (Definitely asked for a stamp card)

The orders took some time, maybe they were all new. Idk.
author: Teena N.

description:
Boba place located conveniently in Chinatown nearby several popular eats including House of Nanking and Chong Qing Xiao Mian.  The menu is the standard with multiple tea options including green, oolong, milk, and almond as well as various boba and pudding types.  

There was a small line when we went, likely due to the lack of great boba options in Chinatown and the relative newness of this venue.

All the options sounded pretty good with the customization nice, but one feature caused me a double take: supposedly you can get a plastic large 24 ounce container for $3.99, but pay more for a smaller 20 ounce container shaped like a classic milk bottle (the logo here is a cow).  The glass container is nicer and does photograph well, but I'll stick to buying my own glassware and go for the bigger serving.  Our choices:

Almond Milk Tea with Almond Pudding 50% sweetness - at first, I thought this was quite sweet but it was more the pudding that was sweet and the almond milk was more mild.  It's a bit grainy like they add some almond powder or some other ingredient.  Overall, ok.

Mango Enjoyable - the photo looks like a mango slushie but I opted  for the version with mango jelly and sago.  It's not too sweet but the mango jelly pieces taste artificial and nothing like real mango pieces.  I guess you can't expect much at this price point.

Overall, ok ingredients, ok flavor and ok stop.

They do accept credit cards.
author: Randy F.

description:
Me and my friend was visiting San Francisco. This place is very hidden. Walked by Chinatown craving for some milk tea and whala! There's a milk tea place right next to me within 10 feet. 

I bought the fresh taro king and my friend bought the tea float with Oolong Milk tea. The 24 oz was $3.99. Which is a very fair price especially in the Chinatown area. 

The Fresh Taro King consists of tro bits and boba. Which was included in the $3.99 price. It even covers tax! The tea float with Oolong Milk tea consisted a scoop of ice cream and boba.

The taro tastes fresh. However, it was a bit "dragged" down. The tea float with Oolong Milk tea tastes a bit too sweet and tastes also a bit "dragged" down but not as bad as mines ( I grabbed his drink and took a sip =] ).

Overall, the price of $3.99 is a fair price in Chinatown for milk tea. However, if you're looking for a more tasty milk tea without the "dragged" down taste/feeling, I'd suggest you try elsewhere.
author: Jonathan Z.

description:
So on my walks around Chinatown I was craving some boba and saw this big happy cow and some cool looking containers and decided to go in and give this place a try. The place is located right next to a vegetarian restaurant.

I had the Taro King Drink, which was a mix of milk, taro and taro powder. It was average at best. The boba was okay, but it didn't really have a pleasant and unique taste, and the texture had hardened in some parts. 

The taro drink itself was kind of boring, not really worth what you pay for. It was plain, there were pieces of taro, but the drink still tasted pretty artificial, and it just didn't have all the goodness of a high quality boba drink.

Overall a pass, since if you're in the area there are just so many good boba options that it really doesn't make sense to come here.
author: Tyler T.

description:
I'll be honest, wasn't expecting much from this place when I walked in, thought it would be a gimmicky milk tea spot.  Man was I wrong!  Their Winnie the Pooh drink is absolutely amazing.  Consists of mango and Lechi, not accompanied each other great!  

They also give you two container options: a cup PR a plastic bottle with a top.  The bottle looks to be made of nice quality plastics.  Sadly I don't want to get the bottle cause it's not green, But it's a nice option. The cup also gives you more liquids.

Found my new boba place!

Advice to the owner: instead of plastic bottles, glass bottles would be nicer and probably greener.  You could also do something like "bring your previously purchased container and get $1 off or something of the sort.
author: Nathan S.

description:
I honestly don't get why people think the taste of the drinks here are not good/ watered down... The 3 times I've been here I feel like all flavors are been good and they ARE NOT POWDER based. Unlike other places, I can taste the fruit and see the chunks of it in the drinks. I don't even see any powder residue after finishing my drink. 

Black sesame - so good!!! Such a unique flavor too. I don't think I've ever see this flavor on the menu. If you're looking for something not too sweet, this is a go to!

Almond Queen - almond flavor galore! They even give you jelly & boba!!! 

Thai Tea - this one had more creamer than I wanted but tasted like Thai tea, nothing special. 

$3.50 for 24oz plastic
$4.99 for 20oz glass bottle (but 10% off your purchase when you reuse - so the total is $3.45)

So after doing the calculation, the 20oz is not more expensive, but you aren't saving anything either. Well technically you're saying a penny... AND THE ENVIRONMENT. But no, seriously. I think 20oz of the drink is perfect size if you're not trying to over drink. 

For anyone that works near Chinatown, this is the spot to get your boba fix. They're quick and have enough flavors for you to try. Definitely will come back here! Don't forget to ask for a stamp card too! You'll get a free drink after your 10th stamp!!
author: Nicole C.

description: I ordered the taro boba for myself and tried my cousins' caramel boba (with pudding) and Winnie the Pooh boba. The taro flavor was sweet and smooth. However, there were unidentifiable chunks of what could have been clumped powder flavor. I'm not sure, and was slightly grossed out. The caramel boba tasted like dulce de leche. The pudding was really sweet and the texture made the drink taste a little strange. The Winnie the Pooh beverage was very sugary, but the flavors worked. I ended up tossing my beverage after drinking a little more than half. We went here because of convenience despite knowing the yelp reviews. The boba pearls were ok. They could have been softer. I also wish they had smaller cup sizes. 24 oz. is the smallest.
author: Jenni K.

description: my bff put me on today. I got winnie the pooh, yes it a drink, not a bear. I looked at the drinks for 20 minutes before I drank it. I mean whats the instruction? LOL. when you serve a pretty drink, it needs to come with instructions. idk if I should suck it, lick the top, shake it up? lol I was a bit "lost" in a good way. and now I'm staring at the empty bottle like what did I do wrong?
author: Kris J.

description:
# 18 E Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 

Too milky for my taste (hence the cow) .  They fall at #18 in my boba rankings below.

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale. 
# 1 Itea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 9/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars 
# 2 Puppy bobar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 8/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars 
# 3 Asha Tea House *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 4 Caffee Central *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 5 Cool Tea  *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 6 The Boba Shop *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 7 Good Earth Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 8 Hanlin Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 9 Keep it *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 10 Wonder Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 11 Tpumps *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/7 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars 
# 12 The Ramen Bar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 6/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 13 Sharetea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 14 Tanca *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 15 Boba Guys *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 16 Steep (not Steap) *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 17 T&T Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *3 stars 
# 18 E Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/6 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 19 Steap (not Steep) *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 20 Maggies Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 21 Sweet Heart Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 22 Honeycreme *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 23 Elixiria *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 24 Quickly *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 25 Plentea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 4/4 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 26 Mi tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 27 Ten Ren Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 28 Wonderful Foods/Dessert & Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 29 Out the Door *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 
# 30 I Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
author: Rod M.

description:
I came here on two separate occasions and tried the Coconut Taro Sago drink and the Honeydew Milk Tea with Boba. I thought the coconut drink tasted sort of powderish and was not that good. However, the Honeydew drink was pretty well made. I would actually order the honeydew drink again if I came back.

The staff behind the counter was nice and I like their cow logo on the cups. I think the pricing is pretty fair, but you may want to skip on paying the extra 50 cents for the glass bottle.
author: Victor L.

description:
Pros: Literally a hole in the wall! Just enough space for less than 10 people inside but luckily they're fast with the drinks. Drinks were just so-so. The guava was a bit bland for my taste but nothing really stands out here except for the cute bottle.
 
Cons: Cashier woman was strictly all business and when I realized the drinks I ordered didn't come with the bottle she seemed pretty irritated. Barely a line at the time and I asked to pay the extra charge. Additional $0.50/bottle and cash only for the bottle upgrade. Glad a nicer person came to assist me as the other woman made our drinks.
 
Ordered: Guava, Mango and Winnie the Pooh. Approx $5 each with the glass bottle.
 
Would I recommend: Yes just to check it out once and if you're in the area but you can get better milk tea elsewhere.
author: Terry N.

description:
I decided to give this place a couple tries to give a fair review. This place is interesting, as it seems to be a part of Enjoy Vegetarian right next door. The first time I came here, I went to the actual spot, which was a small space-a counter to order, pretty much. No seating. The second time, I ordered E Tea was with my meal at Enjoy Vegetarian (just a tip if you want to enjoy some boba with your meal). 

I've tried the Black Tea Float and the Fresh Fruit Tea in the Strawberry flavor. The Black Tea Float I was hoping would have a similar taste to Sharetea's, but lacked in sweetness/flavor. I enjoyed the Strawberry tea more than the float, but still, I was not necessarily wow'ed. I tried some of my friend's Fresh Taro King, and while it did taste fresh, I felt as though the flavor was not there. Both times I felt as if the drinks could have been significantly improved had they added some more ice (I ended up adding some more ice myself). It's great if they want to prevent the drink from being diluted and potentially losing more flavor, but the coldness really makes the drink that much more enjoyable. 

Being in an area of a myriad of boba options, E Tea would not be my first choice, but they do offer decent drinks. I know this place is fairly new as it just opened up a couple weeks ago, so there is always room for improvement! The Winnie the Pooh sounds pretty refreshing. Maybe I'll give that a try the next time I'm eating at Enjoy Vegetarian.
author: Meghan J.

description:
Came here on my lunch break on a Friday. There was no line and it took only like 5 minutes. 

I got the fresh taro king with almond milk and boba. It was very creamy and tasted delicious! Glad they had almond milk as an option!! 

Will be back to try more! I got the glass cup so hopefully if I bring it back you get the drinks discounted, I forgot to ask. Yummy boba though :)
author: Hayley D.

description: Got my order wrong and when I told them. They just said sorry and that they threw the tea out already. Also closed 30 minutes early.
author: Dandre C.

description:
TL;DR: Pretty decent drinks available in a cute milk glass bottle.

Tiny little place along Kearny next to a restaurant. The drinks that they have are actually very similar to Plentea. Prices are roughly $3.99 for a 24oz plastic cup and $4.50 for a 20oz glass milk bottle (but hey, it's good for the Insta). We had the Taro King and Matcha Red Bean, each at 25% sweetness. We went a bit late at night so they were actually out of boba so I replaced the boba with sago in the Taro drink. The taro is made with half real taro and half powder but the flavor wasn't all that strong unlike somewhere like Teaspoon, the sago was also a bit clumped up. The red beans in the matcha drink were also a bit mushy and the matcha flavor wasn't that strong. The service was nice but you could tell they were new as they were training someone in the back. 

Overall, a decent place especially if you want to collect more boba glass bottles (no refund on bringing a bottle back unlike Plentea) with average boba.
author: Jason W.

description:
Their milk teas are mediocre, and the boba is usually VERY sticky. Its nearly even impossible to separate them with the straw let alone drinking it because the boba ends up stuck at the tip of the straw. I suggest to stir the boba up a little bit before serving it to customers.

The only thing I enjoy from this place is their fruit teas especially honeydew and peach! I've encountered with cashiers that don't know certain drinks already include the toppings. I assume that employee is new but pls train them well...
author: Kathy D.

description:
I came because I heard that they serve bubble tea in these really cute bottles but apparently they don't do that anymore. I was a little disappointed and I was also disappointed in the drink. I ordered a hot Fresh Taro King there and I am not sure if the shaker stirred my drink well since there were whole chunks of powder on the bottom. It was actual chunks of taro powder and not mashed taro.

 The service was also really slow. I waited 15 minutes for just one drink. I suppose the cashier and shaker is new. 

I didn't know they allow you to adjust the cup size and ice & sugar level. And they didn't tell me about their stamp cards. I didn't know about it until I read other fellow reviews on Yelp.
author: Angel Yi L.

description: Got a few different kinds, all very tasty. A bit sweet but that should be expected. Service was great, cute little spot downtown with easy access. My niece loved it!
author: Jessie A.

description: Great flavors.  Had the honeydew milk tea and the mango green milk tea. ..   taro is next  ... try the more exotic flavors.  Prices are reasonable too.  Nice staff.  They were happy to make it 75% sugar if you prefer to less sweet.
author: Gina G.

description: Walked by this place after eating dinner at Chinatown and decided to give it a try. I didn't want to anymore milk tea, so I ordered the Chrysanthemum Honey Tea w/ Aloe for $4.75. The drink was very refreshing and since I asked for half sugar, it wasn't too sweet. The aloe pieces were good too. I would recommend this drink if you want something sugary, but refreshing at the same time. The only sad part was I wanted to try this place to collect the glass cup, but they ran out of them.
author: Louanne F.

description:
Wow the thai tea and grassy jelly was a huge mistake. Grass jelly-weird texture, bad taste, tough. Thai tea- weird color, chalky foam, plastic taste. Entire drink--trash. 

I have not heard good things about this place and will not be giving it a second chance. SORRY--Hanlin 2 doors away delivers much better tea even though there are fewer options.
author: Lydia Z.

description:
I got the Honeydew Green Milk Tea with Boba ($3.99). 

The drink was cheap especially since boba was included. I got a lot of boba and it was very chewy and kind of sweet. I liked how the boba had flavor to it. As for the tea, it was average. I could not taste the tea at all. It was nice that the drink never diluted but there was hardly any ice to begin with. With little ice, the drink was not very cold. 

I was hoping to get strawberry milk tea, but I did not see it on the menu.

I am not sure if I will be back considering that there are other better boba places in the area.
author: Kristina M.

description: We got the #20 Rose Tie Guan Yin, 50% sugar...and definitely should've gotten 100% sugar because the salt is over-powering. I would def recommend going full sugar on all salty cheese..and I don't care for very sweet things. I got the lavender milk tea with popping boba and 50% sugar and would've gone up to 75% sweetness, but it's delicious! My friend got salted Carmel #24 with 75% sweetness and loves sweet things and wouldn't have gone up to 100% because it would've been way too much. Hers was DELICIOUS. def Recommend! It had egg custard, pudding and boba. They have the cutest cups, which is great if traveling!!
author: Corinne L.

description:
One of my least favorite drink from boba places... i knew i should of have walked a blocked further and get quickly instead, but i was like let's give this place a try... 
.
Ordered mango sago with boba instead of coconut jelly which is included... then the barista made the drink with coconut jelly and forgot the boba. So he asked me if its ok with coconut, i said ok. So he poured 1/3 of the mango smoothie out, poured the boba, then he went to the fridge and poured more mango smoothie to the top. AT THIS POINT i was turned off how the drink wasn't made fresh, so eeeekkkkk..... 
.
Then i went on yelp to look and saw someone posted a pic of the empty canned mango which is in their garbage can in the front which is like wow no fresh mangos in involved. 
.
Anyways the mango smoothie was not good whatsoever. Wasn't ice cold at all, and overly sweet. As well the boba is bland with no flavor cooked into it. I drank 1/3 of it and call it a quit, as well the pro thing i paid 50 cents extra for the cute bottle, to keep as a souvenir to remind myself don't go again. Thanks for reading and what a boba fix for x mas 2017.
author: Alex T.

description:
After being completely disappointed by another boba spot, we stumbled upon this little hole in the wall. It is a small establishment and there is a line out the door.

I got the fresh taro coconut milk with boba and my kids got the fresh taro milk with boba, honestly they both tasted exactly the same. Both were good but I couldn't really tell the difference.

I asked for extra ice in my drink because I really like my cold drinks cold. However, they did not give me extra ice and my drink for warm really quick. 

My fiancé got a green tea sort of drink half sweet with no pearls, also extra ice and he said he like it. He just wish they put more ice.

If I am back in the area I will be back.
author: Alexandra G.

description:
Super super mediocre... I am between 2 and 3 stars for this place.  The competition for boba in Chinatown is pretty steep - seems like one is closing down while another is opening across the street constantly.

I ordered a rose milk tea and it was just okay...Acceptable in times of desperate need, but not the best.  They offer a 20oz reusable glass bottle or a 24oz (very tall) plastic cup for a little cheaper.  I appreciate that they give you the option -Plentea down the street forces you to buy the glass bottle!  I think the only reason I'd come back here is if I didn't have time to walk a little further down to iTea or Asha.

It's a small shop with barely enough room for more than 3 people to stand inside.  So if the line is out the door - don't be afraid!
author: Kenna H.

description: Statistically average. Taste is decent, fun menu. Would I go back? Sure, but only if it was on the way to something.
author: Jonathan U.

description:
This place is trap. Drinks taste like water. The only thing they have going for them is the glass bottle. Which is the only reason people go. What great marketing! Tea quality is terrible. Service is okay. 

So if you're looking for a bottle, then by all means, it's $4. If you want good tea, look elsewhere
author: Yve N.

description:
Pretty good bubble tea place, loved the use of real taro in the taro king drink. They also have the option of making it into a hot drink, perfect for a chilly day.

they serve in both cups (like normal bubble tea places) and glass jars
author: Emily H.

description: I ordered the Taro drink. It was the nastiest drink I've ever had in my life. I took two sips then threw it in the trash. First time in my life throwing away something after a few sips..
author: John S.

description:
Terrible milk tea. I came here after eating at Enjoy Vegetarian, which I assume is its sister establishment. They have the option for you to pay a little more to get a glass bottle instead of regular plastic one. 

Ordered a Thai iced tea and it is possibly one of the worst Thai iced teas I've ever had. The tea flavor itself was very weak, I don't think they used cream or half and half, and - in fact - the tea was so watered down that the after taste was somehow bad. 

There are much better options for milk tea elsewhere in Chinatown. Do not recommend.
author: Jenny L.

description: Good good good good good good + hard workers Good good good good good good mango smoothie is my shh and the almond queen, i like t-pumps and quickly but this might be a slightly better version. Better quality drinks
author: Ryan L.

description:
They've got a really small location - basically just an ordering counter, no seating or anything, not that it's a problem for a boba place, but just FYI it's only grab and go here.  E Tea has the option to get your tea in a glass jar, which is pretty cool.  Also, their pricing is simple - all the drinks (at least, as far as I can tell) are the same price!

Unfortunately I wasn't a huge fan of the tea.  I ordered a passion fruit green tea with boba. 
 The sweetness level (at 50%) was just right, but there wasn't a whole lot of tea passion fruit flavor.  The boba has a decent consistency but clumped together at the bottom of the jar and didn't have any sweetness (needs to be soaked in honey longer, maybe).

If this review was only based on the tea then it would probably be 2 stars, but customer service was outstanding, so I'm bumping it up to 3.  The cashier was friendly, happy to explain things about the menu, and was able to give recommendations to other customers in line.
author: Bryce A.

description: Ordered my standard milk tea - half sweet, light ice, no boba. It tasted pretty bland, not even much like tea. $3.99. Not the best I've had.
author: Annie L.

description: This location is very convenient when in Chinatown (near Quickly's), and it's a really small non sit down place. Their glass bottles are pretty cute but I didn't get it, even though the price difference is about 40 cents. I ordered their taro king with sago, and no just no. Tasted nothing really like taro, very powdery and watery! I only liked their sago and there were a lot of them. My bf got the caramel ice milk with boba and pudding. That drink was at least ok, but my only complain is their pudding tasted old and not normal like other yellow pudding. I got a stomach ache after drinking the drinks too.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I really enjoy E Tea's boba drinks! I've had them a few times at the Geary location. This location just opened next to my work, so I was ecstatic to try it out.

The boba itself is really good and the packaging is very eye-catching. However, this location took about 15 minutes to get my order ready, which I thought was pretty long....other than that everything else was good!
author: James D.

description:
This review is mainly for the taro milk tea that we ordered.  We always appreciate when real ingredients are used (in this case real taro), but the proportions were not right and it was really gritty.  Would not recommend this.

Had a sip of our kids smoothie and that was decent.
author: Winston L.

description: Small little hole in the wall for tea beverages. I got the house milk tea with some flavor. You have to love this thing but if you do, this place is as good as any other place. Nothing special here but they do have a good selection and the guy was really nice and patient with all my questions.
author: Gil S.

description:
As a pair of nomads we were searching for a place to get some boba tea. We searched on yelp, and came on this street where this shop was located. 
The shop was closing by the time we reached, but the owner was really nice, she allowed us inside even after the shop was closed, and helped us with our boba tea, while telling us in detail about various tea's.
author: Vipul S.

description: horrible boba tea. came on a trip with my family and 2 of my kid's friends. spent $25 on 6 drinks and got completely watered-down milk tea. even with 100% sugar, it was not sweet at all and totally watered down. it's a rip off and a trap for tourists. i tried to ask for more sweetener. they say they added it, but it still tasted the same. we asked for a refund but they said they can't because the owner wasn't there. i ended up throwing it in the trash after 3 sips. also, my son got the strawberry slush. i saw the worker adding strawberry syrup to some water then adding ice. Do NOT waste your money here!
author: Joon C.

description: It was pretty good!  Got the plastic bottle cause it was cute!  Didn't hold much --next time I'll purchase the large size!
author: doris c.

description:
Two stars are for the good service and nice presentation of the place itself. However I was really disappointed in the drink. I got the Taro King drink and it didn't taste right. I've had Taro before and this tasted powdery. After a few sips I started to get little balls of the powder in my mouth, so that explains why it tasted that way. The drink is blended and perhaps it wasn't blended enough but I was really excited for the drink because it looks so good, but the taste was the worst Taro I've ever had. Boba was good tho. Unfortunately I got all the boba from the bottom that I could, then had to throw my drink away because I couldn't get past all the powder that was left in it. 

Overall: nice presentation and good boba, but the drink itself was bad.
author: Victoria H.

description:
The tea here is kinda below expectation. I ordered the one with ice cream. Somehow they were able to make it half less sweet and half super sweet. Well, I don't know if I would come back. 

The plus side is, they offer glass bottles, which look pretty cute. I didn't choose it tho, opted for the plastic cup for a better deal :P
author: Willie G.

description: Business said they're open until 9:30. Got here at 8:55 and the guy said they're close at 8:45. Huh?!!!
author: Dan N.

description: I don't know why this place has so many bad reviews. I got the Winnie the Pooh and I thought it was delicious ! Super refreshing and I even added aloe which made it even better. 75% sugar was plenty.
author: Trang N.

description: Drinks have sweetness of 50% as minimum. They should include a lower % like 30% for those who don't like too much sugar in their drinks. What caught my eye was the cow logo and that's why I ended up here instead of the other boba place down the street. The Princess Rose Tea with lichen was good. If you opt for the plastic bottle with twist cap it's a good 50cents more with 4oz less of your drink.
author: W A.

description: I have no problem with E Tea whatsoever. Not only do they have a cute cow as their mascot, but they also have reusable cups (20oz). Their regular-sized goodies are 24oz, and you can customize both sweetness and ice levels. I am a huge fan of all things taro, and their #15 Fresh Taro King is insanely creamy and taro-filled. Best get it at 24oz with no boba. They take credit cards, so no need to bring cash. Unfortunately, that 24oz drink is almost $4. Little steep, but quite delicious. You'll thank me later.
author: Danny C.

description: This place was a bait/scam for Tourists. They used water instead of milk, barely any sugar. We ordered 2 Taro kings, 1 honeydew yakult, jasmine milk tea, Rose milk tea, and strawberry no honey boba. Oh my goodness. It was Terrible. Taro was SO thick even though it was just milk tea and I had one with Rainbow jelly and was DiSgUStIng. So much chunks of taro powder. The rainbow jelly is so hard and gross. Honeydew Yakult was the WORST with Jasmine milk tea. It tastes so Bitter, gross, and SOO watered down. It is absolute crap. The Jasmine Milk tea was also so gross. SO bitter SO watered down. I thought milk tea was like milky not kinda cloudy-clear. The rose Milk tea was gross. My mom just threw it right away. Watered down. Not sweet no matter how much sugar we asked for. Lastly, the strawberry one. Was just syrup, water, half of the container with ice. The 5 year old kid wanted to see how gross it was and he spit them out. The ok-est one was the strawberry one though this was also bad. Chinatown is a HUGE spam. We wasted so much money. The workers here were so rude and the people wouldnt give us a refund for this crap. I wish There was an option for 0 stars cuz this 0 is absolutely how much stars they deserve.
author: Gyuri H.

description: Usually when I'm at a new boba spot, I would always try their fruit teas because I'm not a fan of milk teas. I ordered the Honey Lemon Aloe  it was good not to sweet, just normal their aloe was good as well compared to other boba spot. I was hoping they would have popping pearls but I guess not. I'll definitely try their other drinks when I come back.
author: Keren K.

description: Really small place located in Chinatown. Good for on the go, because there's no chairs to sit down. You'll have to stand while waiting. Drinks took a while to make and tasted decent. I tried the lemon ginger tea with aloe and got it in a plastic bottle with a cap. I think they ran out of the glass milk ones :/
author: Amy L.

description:
The drinks are pretty marginal here and not good. The milk tea drinks taste very watered down as if it has been sitting around with the ice already melted.

The one good thing about this place is the glass bottle, which is unique and def reusable. Other than that, the drink is better at share tea. Even the drinks at tapioca express are better!
author: Ethyl M.

description: A little pricey, but I think their tea is really yummy. I'm not too big of a fan of really sweet milk tea, and I found their 100% sweetness to be very good for me. I would be wary of getting less sweet.
author: Michelle Z.

description: This is a nice place to go on a hot day for some cool drinks - there's only takeout though since it's a small place with no seating area. The boba was good, but could have used a bit more flavour as it tasted a bit watered down. I had a mango sago with lychee jelly and my bf had the Winnie the Pooh (strawberry green tea with mango milk and lychee jelly). The line was long when I was here, but the service was friendly and fast.
author: Bianca C.

description: A little gem in a hole in a wall. Was in San Fran last weekend and came across this tea counter. I ordered the caramel milk and the boba consistency was on point. It was yummy tasting and the price cheaper than most. You can get it in a 24 oz cup or a plastic sports bottle which is plenty. Street parking with meters on weekdays. Will definitely be back when in town.
author: Belinda N.

description: Cow! It's logo is so cute, and I have to admit that's what attracted me at first. They have a pretty large selection of drinks, but no place to sit (or really stand, even) and it reminds me of the boba shops in Hong Kong. I got the almond jasmine tea boba, and for whatever reason, it wasn't sweet at all! There was no other flavor except for the slight almond flavor. Maybe it's my misunderstanding and assumed the drinks would be sweet like any other boba tea drink out there but I was very disappointed. My friend got the coconut taro and unfortunately they use powered taro mix. Sad to say, but I probably won't be back. Many other options around the area.
author: Athena L.

description:
No...why is there no good boba in this corner of Chinatown?! I was so excited to see a new boba place as I frequent cool tea bar down the block. I'm too lazy to walk to sharetea or itea a couple blocks down. Those who work in Fidi know what I'm talking about! 

They have a large menu and it's your typical boba joint. I came around 12:30pm on a weekday and the line was pretty long. They were pretty slow at taking the orders and pushing out the drinks. However the cashier was extremely friendly and served everyone with a smile! She happily answered any questions and it's rare to see that level of customer service nowadays. Props to her! 

I got the taro king drink and it didn't taste like taro AT ALL. I don't think I'm a picky boba drinker. Yeah I frequent itea and other popular boba chains, but I feel that you can't mess up a taro milk tea. Well, that's not the case. 

Taro drink was completely watered down. It says it comes with fresh taro which it did, but one may think it will intensify the boba drink. All I tasted was the milk and taro chunks. No taro flavoring at all. Maybe they didn't use enough powder? Who knows. 

I'm not sure if I'll return. If I do I may try their flavored tea instead of milk teas. Let's hope things will improve!
author: Sarah I.

description:
Small tea shop. Didn't have matcha frap  and their flavored milk tea are from syrup. Except for taro (the only artificial flavor I wanted). 

Ordered a house milk tea w/ pearl 25% sweetness for myself  and mocha frap w/pearl in their glass "milk jar" for my friend. 

Milk tea: I give it 3 stars. Had a strong chocolate aroma, I think if I requested 50% sweetness it would of tasted better. 
Mocha frap: give it 2 stars. tried my friends drink, it had a lingering almond powder taste. Honestly I thought it tastes weird. 

Overall 3 stars, still better than quicklys a block away
author: Jenny P.

description:
Poor customer service. Boba is subpar. Don't buy. Eek!
Poor customer service. Boba is subpar. Don't buy. Eek!
author: Kit K.

description: They were so helpful in helping us to pick out a milk tea, and the place was spotless!!! The tea was great and the prices were fabulous. We are going to try out their other location on Geary in the Richmond district if we have time during our vacation.
author: Seth S.

description:
E Tea and Enjoy Vegetarian share a space. If you're eating lunch at Enjoy Vegetarian, you can also order drinks from E Tea! They will add your drinks onto your bill. My friend and I didn't know that until we were done with our meals. We were packing up our leftovers from lunch and noticed that the server provided an E Tea menu to a nearby table. We requested the drink menu as well and decided to order our drinks inside so we wouldn't have to wait outside in the rain. If you're outside ordering from E Tea only, there's only enough space to go to the counter to order and then you step aside or outside to wait for your drink.

This was our second time ordering a drink from here. Last week, I got a Fresh Taro King with boba and this week I tried the Green Milk Tea with boba. I thought the boba was decent but the drinks lacked flavor. They're not sweet enough and they do not ask how sweet you would like your drink. I would come again if I'm eating at Enjoy Vegetarian but if I'm craving a sweet boba drink, I would pass on E Tea and go somewhere else nearby.
author: Jenn W.

description:
I had their jasmine green milk tea w/ boba (regular sweet) and it had great tea flavor and a good amount of sweetness. The boba was a nice chewy texture and was sweet- no complaints. My sister got their oolong milk tea (50% sweet) and unfortunately hers was not very flavorful and seemed watered down- maybe because she got 50% sweet? Would not recommend.


Prices are fair and this is a great addition to Kearny. I also tried their mango sago drink at their Geary St location and I really enjoyed that one but it's a bit pricy. Also important to note that this is truly a to-go type of boba place where you just order and go. There is no seating or restrooms. They also have s second location on Geary and this one has seating and shares a space with a restaurant (so yes bathroom).
author: Kathleen Y.

description: Got the taro one and asked for 50% sugar. Pro tip, if you normally like it a little sweet by normally boba standards, don't do 50% here, just do the normal sugar. It was nice to get a glass bottle and the taro had chunks, overall just missed the spot. I tried someone else's normal boba, and the bobas stuck together...making it very hard to eat. Probably not getting the same flavors or maybe even coming back
author: Victor D.

description: Very tasty place! I got the Winnie the Pooh drink and it was great! My wife got the coffee chocolate smoothie thing and man that thing was so strong! We both had a great time with friends!
author: Jake A.

description:
We gave this place a chance but not satisfied with the product. They lack of flavor was impressive and the sweetener was no where to be found.
They have a fancy glass bottle that is too expensive and gives you less ounces of tea ... if you return with the bottle then u get 10% discount.
author: Ice F.

description: Do the same people own this tea shop as Enjoy Vegetarian next door? Tea was nasty. It tastes like the owners are going cheap on all the ingredients. Truly foul.
author: Kristy M.

description: Yum! Get the fresh taro milk tea 75% sugar recommended  not too sweet so you can taste the taro. I like how fresh the drink tastes! Tapioca is cooked well n chewy
author: Tiffany B.

description: I'm addicted to the Mango Sago. So good specially when it's really hot out. It's very refreshing! A must try
author: Bryan B.

description:
Extremely Rude Service!  My drink total was $3.99, gave the cashier a $10.00 bill and she gave me back $6.00 instead of $6.01.  I told her that I she should've given me the .01 for correct change.  She then asked "Do you want the penny then?" I said "No, but you should've given it to me instead of assuming I don't want it."  She then said "Next customer!"  

There are plenty of boba shops around you guys, don't think you can give incorrect change with rude service and think you're the only boba shop in town.
author: Jeffrey T.

description: I ordered the House Milk Tea w/ Boba, 50% sweet. Drink tasted like watered down chocolate milk. It is on the cheaper side relative to other boba places.
author: Derek T.

description:
Get their fruit drinks. Stay away from the basics.

Their fruity drinks are amazing! I love that they have pairings (toppings/drinks) already there on the menu. The Winnie the Pooh drink is my favorite. I got their basic jasmine milk tea and that was not their best. It was mainly milk and not very much tea.
author: Kelly T.

description: We always come here when we visit my husband grandma. They are fast and they quality of the tea is actually good and decent price and very friendly which i like , always our spot when we come here.They have unique flavors so you should try them
author: Hoa T.

description: Ordered the Taro King. Does not taste that good. Texture was too thick and the boba was not chewy....Will not order again
author: J.J I.

description: Winnie the Pooh is surprisingly good! The place is a hole in the wall but easy to find
author: Minh N.

description: Terrible boba here. I drink boba way too much, and I'd say this is probably the worst I've tasted in a long while. The boba pearls are mushy, the tea doesn't taste like tea, and the milk was watered down. Plenty of other places in the area, wouldn't recommend going here.
author: Cheechee L.

description: this tea place was absolutely amazing. my friends and i were just walking around and discovered it- but we couldn't be more thankful. i got the jasmine green tea in a bottle, which was amazing. the boba was very delicious, and the actual tea was a little creamy- but it just added to the wonderfulness. as per the Winnie the Pooh, my friend described it as  an amazing balance of mango *milk?* and strawberry juice, with the lychee and mango bits leaving a nice sweet but slightly sour taste. overall this place did not taste like generic boba found at chain restaurants; it was very unique and delicious.
author: Nandita R.

description: Well coming from Asia where bubble tea started like more than 25 years ago what's there not to like about the bubble tea here? Totally baffling as to what the issues are for those who gave such poor reviews. With sugar level adjustable and ingredients fresh and flavorful instead of diluted versions elsewhere all of which  makes for a to-die-for bubble tea. The girls were meticulous in cleaning up and measuring up as well as blending carefully all necessary ingredients so it's a joy to see such a hygienic and systematic system of preparation. I won't hesitate to visit again after 18 hours of flying from my part of the world to SF! Good job!
author: Peck Suen H.

description: This place just opened up about 2 weeks ago. We just discovered it across the street from the job the other day. Drinks I have to say are super yummy. I've tried Winnie the Pooh, matcha with almond milk, and almond queen. All delicious. Prices are not bad at all considering you pay the same amount for smaller and not so good stuff. Will be back for sure. Tip: if you get the drink bottled and bring it back to them they give you 10% off your order.
author: T A.

description: Very unorganized and confused staff making the line & wait very long. Ordered my favorite, Jasmine milk boba tea, which they put so much cream in it literally just tastes like milk with bobas in it (ew). The bobas are not a good consistency & the flavor is just not there. This is my first time dumping out a boba tea -- it was terrible.
author: Erica J.

description: I happen to walk by this milk tea place and wanted to try it out and it was really disappointing. My friend got a jasmine milk green tea and I got a yukult milk tea. The jasmine milk tea has absolutely no milk flavor in it, the tea is super bitter and without any sugar. The yukult milk tea has a very strange after taste, also there was no milk in this "milk tea". It tasted amazingly horrible that I had to pour it out. I felt like we basically paid for 1 glass bottle and 1 plastic bottle.
author: Sylvia H.

description: Tried the milk black tea w/ boba. Not bad, and very strong tea!
author: Lung W.

description: It's a small counter and there was a bit of a line when I came in. It went by fast and when I went to the counter, customer service was friendly. I ordered the 20oz hokkaido milk tea that came with boba and pudding in a cute glass bottle. My drink was prepared fast but the flavor was not as appealing as I thought it would be. It was very weak plus the pudding was bland. The boba was chewy and sweet. It could have been made better. I would come back to try their other popular drinks though.
author: Amy L.

description: The mango sasa and taro King is really good, most important they have very good service
author: Ye Feng J.

description: the people there sucks ,tea taste like crap,
author: Donald W.

description: Pretty good boba tea but the service is slower than watching molasses. They must find a better way to streamline the process of making these boba with 4 people working.
author: Lisa M.

description: Can't believe they ran out of boba at 5pm. Strawberry popping boba and lychee jelly were tasteless. Will not go back!
author: Ivy Xiaoling J.
